message: Announced this morning. Coming next year. Info at E3. I'm happy.
Hrm. Soul Calibur IV felt like a step back for the series from SC3, despite the pretty graphics, so I'll wait and see.
Oh, who am I kidding, I'm going to buy it anyway. <3 Soul Calibur

Also, who will the guest characters be this time? Online speculation favors Naruto, which would make sense given the surprising success of Ultimate Ninja Storm 2. And as a huge fan of that game, a crossover with SC would be one of the best things ever for me :)

I really liked the story mode in SC3, but nothing else :) SC2's been the best one so far, IMHO, followed by IV (because of the online, which I played to death). My main hope for the new one is that it has the same beefy single player modes as the first three.
I haven't played any since II (which was brilliant).  I'd hate to speculate as to the extent to which certain anatomical features have become… enhanced… by now.
I just want a proper, incredibly elaborate CG intro this time. Is that too much to ask?

… I remember sitting in that little shop upstairs from Greenmarket Square (if you're from Cape Town, YOU KNOW THE ONE) and playing Soul Calibur over and over on the Dreamcast.  And the arcade unit they had there.
I don't know what's more unbelievable, the fact that they did it or the fact that they… you know, *did that*.
As utterly unbelievable as it sounds, Namco's actually given the dev team restrictions w.r.t. breast size for this installment.
New main character: Patroklos/Patrocles/Patroclus (spelling TBC, apparently). Let's just call him the Knight of Flowers. http://i54.tinypic.com/bim8bb.gif

I never had anyone to play SC4 with me locally, meaning that I hardly played it except for online. And as for online, it's the one game where playing online killed the enjoyment for me. Attempting a guard-deflect with any kind of lag was just impossible, meaning that everyone who's everyone picked Astaroth, Nightmare or Darth Vader and just pummeled their way through each round. Got up to the point where I just deciced that I'm shelving the game for good. So basically I have zero excitement for SC5 (even though SC2 was my most played fighter ever).
I don't know about international lag, but local online play is really solid in SC4. ZAnimus and I were just playing it last night.

New trailer, with some "gameplay" footage. It looks impressive. 

http://www.gametrailers.com/video/e3-2011-soul-calibur/714560
